We want to put the smallest digit in the greatest place value. 

Which digit is the smallest?

$\maroonD4$ is the smallest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD4$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{4}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next smallest digit:  $\blueD6$.  

  So  $\blueD6$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{4}{,}\blueD6$ $\_$ $\_$

The next smallest digit is the $\purpleC8$.  The $\purpleC8$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{4}{,}\blueD6\purpleC8$  $\_$

The greatest digit is the $\greenD9$.  The  $\greenD9$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{4}{,}\blueD6\purpleC8\greenD9$ 

The smallest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{4}{,}\blueD6\purpleC8\greenD9$.
